What @SenateDems want — and I think what the public wants — is a fair trial with witnesses who have relevant information to the serious charges at hand. pic.twitter.com/6aEsCFtx4Y

The oath I took today is not to a political party. It is not to the President. It is to the Constitution.

I intend to uphold that oath. I intend to listen to the case presented, and I intend to eventually render a verdict based on all available facts and evidence. pic.twitter.com/Us1ai8wktJ

Today, Americans woke up to the unsettling news that Iraqi lawmakers have voted to expel American troops — and U.S. anti-ISIS activities have been put on hold amid safety concerns.

It is hard to see how the Trump administration’s actions have made us more safe.
Contrary to what the Secretary of State is claiming, tensions with Iran began to worsen AFTER the Trump Administration foolishly backed out of  #JCPOA.
Today, in retaliation against the Trump administration’s reckless actions, the Iranians are promising to no longer hold up their end of #JCPOA.

This is nonsensical. #JCPOA was a carefully crafted multi-national agreement to keep Iran from building up its nuclear capabilities — and independent validators determined the Iranians were abiding by it. https://twitter.com/joshrogin/status/1213833817473069056 …

The American people and the men and women serving our country in the Middle East deserve a better foreign policy than senseless escalation. Congress and the American people need to hear what the administration’s strategy is. And it must be based on facts and rooted in truth.

I hope and pray that this administration will take swift action to de-escalate tensions with Iran — and to ensure the safety and security of our personnel abroad. But instead, I fear we are watching in real time as our posture toward Iran grows ever more dangerous.

Instead of bringing Iran to the table for a better deal as promised, this administration has left our European allies in the lurch by abrogating the carefully negotiated #JCPOA and now, by carrying out a major military strike without proper consultation with allies or Congress.
When it comes to Iran, the Trump administration has repeatedly chosen rash provocation over strategic solutions or diplomacy.

It was a similar situation with the Iraq War in 2003. 

4,100 men and women laid down their lives based on the lie we were told that Iraq had weapons of mass destruction.

I am the only Vietnam veteran still serving in the U.S. Senate. I served alongside the 55,000 men and women who lost their lives in the Vietnam War. They died, and many of us risked our lives, in a war that was premised on a lie. https://twitter.com/rcallimachi/status/1213421769777909761 …
